summary: Pyrite, also known as fool's gold, is an iron sulfide mineral with the formula FeS2. It's the most common sulfide mineral and looks like gold, which is where its nickname comes from. Pyrite's shiny, brass-yellow color can be found in various rocks and even in coal. The name comes from the Greek word for "fire-stone," as it can create sparks when hit with steel. Despite its nickname, real gold is sometimes found with pyrite.
title: Pyrite
